data.name: Unplanned Resource Outages Report
data.description: This report contains a snapshot of all unplanned Resource outages (i.e., Forced Outages and Maintenance Outages) and derates that were active in the Outage Scheduler at any time on the third day before the posting date of this report. The data for these outages is submitted by operators of generation assets and is used by ERCOT staff in the operation of the Texas power grid. This report does not contain Resource outages for generators that are no longer operational on the Texas power grid or have not begun operating on the Texas power grid. This report contains all outages for Resources that are required to enter outages in the ERCOT Outage Scheduler including Generation Resources in Private Use Networks, and Energy Storage Resources. Some smaller operational derates are not required to be reported.

data.name: Hourly Resource Outage Capacity
data.description: This report includes all approved and accepted Planned, Forced and Maintenance Resource outages EXCEPT Resource outages for retirement of old equipment, seasonal mothballed (during the outaged season), and mothballed. The outage capacity in this report reflects aggregated ACTIVE resource outaged capacity by Load Zone sourced from the Outage Scheduler (OS) for the next 168 hours and is published every hour. Columns ‘C’ - ‘F’ consists of the aggregated outaged capacity of ALL the ACTIVE resource outages by Load Zone in the OS for each hour excluding the outages stated above, IRR resource outages, and new equipment outages. Columns ‘G’ - ‘J’ consists of the aggregated outaged capacity of ALL the ACTIVE IRR resource outages by Load Zone in the OS for each hour excluding the outages stated above, outages in columns ‘C’ - ‘F’ and new equipment outages. Columns ‘K’ - ‘N’ consists of the aggregated outaged capacity of ALL the ACTIVE New Equipment Energization resource outages by Load Zone. Note that this report contains OS data only and does not look at telemetry. It includes both entire resource outage and de-rates.

artifacts.displayName: Hourly Resource Outage Capacity

data.description: The available On-Line Resource capacity for Generation Resources and the available capacity for Load Resources, for each hour of the current day and six days forward.

data.name: 3-Day SCED Highest Price AS Offer Selected
data.description: This report provides the offer price and the name of the Entity submitting the offer for the highest-priced Ancillary Service (AS) Offer selected in the Real-Time Market (RTM) for each AS three days after the end of the applicable Operating Day.  If multiple Entities submitted the highest-priced offers selected, all Entities shall be identified.

artifacts.displayName: 3-Day SCED Highest Price AS Offer Selected

data.name: 3-Day DAM Highest Price AS Offer Selected
data.description: This report provides the offer price and the name of the Entity submitting the offer for the highest-priced Ancillary Service (AS) Offer selected in the Day-Ahead Market (DAM) for each AS three days after the end of the applicable Operating Day.  If multiple Entities submitted the highest-priced offers selected, all Entities shall be identified.

artifacts.displayName: 3-Day DAM Highest Price AS Offer Selected

data.name: 7-Day Event Trigger Posting
data.description: Seven days after the applicable Operating Day, ERCOT shall post the portion of any Resource's Energy Offer Curve or Energy Bid/Offer Curve that is at or above 50 times the Fuel Index Price (50xFIP) for any Security-Constrained Economic Dispatch (SCED) interval in the Real-Time Market (RTM) where any Real-Time Locational Marginal Price (LMP) exceeds 50xFIP, or the portion of any Resource’s Ancillary Service Offer that is at or above 50xFIP for any operating Hour in Day-Ahead Market (DAM) or any SCED intervals in Real-Time Market (RTM) where any Ancillary Service Market Clearing Price for Capacity (MCPC) exceeds 50xFIP.

artifacts.displayName: 7-Day Event Trigger Posting when LMP exceeds 50xFIP
7-Day Event Trigger Posting When DAM MCPC Exceeds 50xFIP
7-Day Event Trigger Posting when RTM MCPC exceeds 50xFIP

data.name: Total Ancillary Service Offers
data.description: The total quantity in MW of Offers per Ancillary Service per hour from the Day-Ahead Market for the last thirty days on a daily basis which includes the following AS types: REGDN, REGUP, RRSPFR, RRSFFR, RRSUFR, NSPIN, ECRSS & ECRSM. Report removed with PR447-03 RTC.  Link to remain available until postings have expired.

artifacts.displayName: Total Ancillary Service Offers

data.name: DAM and SCED Ancillary Service Demand Curves
data.description: Ancillary Service Demand Curve (ASDC) data for all AS Types by hour that will be used by DAM and SCED to procure Ancillary Services. If the AS Plan is altered, a new ASDC will be posted to reflect this change for applicable hours.

artifacts.displayName: DAM and SCED Ancillary Service Demand Curves

data.description: Ancillary Service requirements by type and quantity for each hour of the current day plus the next 6 days

artifacts.displayName: DAM Ancillary Service Plan

data.name: Emergency Pricing Program Cumulative Hours Tracking
data.description: This report updates every 15 minutes and shows the sum of the Real-Time Market (RTM) System Lambda and Real-Time Reliability Deployment Price Adder for Energy, time-weight averaged to a 15-minute Settlement Interval. If this sum is greater than or equal to the High System-Wide Offer Cap for the Day-Ahead Market (DAM) for 12 hours within a rolling 24-hour period, an Emergency Offer Cap Effective Period initiates at the beginning of the next Operating Hour.

artifacts.displayName: Emergency Pricing Program Cumulative Hours Tracking

data.name: Hourly System-wide and Regional Wind Forecasts by Model
data.description: This report is posted every hour and includes system-wide and regional STWPF and WGRPP values produced by each forecast model for On-Line WGRs and the wind generation components of DC-Coupled Resources for the rolling historical 48-hour period and the rolling future 168-hour period and also indicates which forecast model is used for each region to populate COPs.  Previously named:  Hourly System-wide and Regional STWPF and WGRPP by Forecast Model.  Name change with implementation of PR373-01 FPP.

artifacts.displayName: Hourly System-wide and Regional Wind Forecasts by Model
